The private sorrow of a beloved wife and children, whom death has prematurely deprived of every thing that conjugal and parental fond- ness is capable of bestowing, is the ordinary subject of that sympathy which melts the heart at the sight of the Widow's tears and the Orphan's woe: and seldom does melancholy subject occur with a more touching appeal to this sentiment, than in the present instance. But the death of this estimable man must awaken in every bosom something more than sympathy.
